distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the US Accidents (2016 - 2023) dataset

distribution.name: US_Accidents_March23.csv
distribution.description: Comprehensive countrywide accident dataset spanning from February 2016 to the end of March 2023.

field.name: ID
field.description: This is a unique identifier of the accident record.

field.name: Source
field.description: Source of raw accident data

field.name: Severity
field.description: Shows the severity of the accident, a number between 1 and 4, where 1 indicates the least impact on traffic (i.e., short delay as a result of the accident) and 4 indicates a significant impact on traffic (i.e., long delay).

field.name: Start_Time
field.description: Shows start time of the accident in local time zone.

field.name: End_Time
field.description: Shows end time of the accident in local time zone. End time here refers to when the impact of accident on traffic flow was dismissed.

field.name: Start_Lat
field.description: Shows latitude in GPS coordinate of the start point.

field.name: Start_Lng
field.description: Shows longitude in GPS coordinate of the start point.

field.name: End_Lat
field.description: Shows latitude in GPS coordinate of the end point.

field.name: End_Lng
field.description: Shows longitude in GPS coordinate of the end point.

field.name: Distance(mi)
field.description: The length of the road extent affected by the accident in miles.

field.name: Description
field.description: Shows a human provided description of the accident.

field.name: Street
field.description: Shows the street name in address field.

field.name: City
field.description: Shows the city in address field.

field.name: County
field.description: Shows the county in address field.

field.name: State
field.description: Shows the state in address field.

field.name: Zipcode
field.description: Shows the zipcode in address field.

field.name: Country
field.description: Shows the country in address field.

field.name: Timezone
field.description: Shows timezone based on the location of the accident (eastern, central, etc.).

field.name: Airport_Code
field.description: Denotes an airport-based weather station which is the closest one to location of the accident.

field.name: Weather_Timestamp
field.description: Shows the time-stamp of weather observation record (in local time).

field.name: Temperature(F)
field.description: Shows the temperature (in Fahrenheit).

field.name: Wind_Chill(F)
field.description: Shows the wind chill (in Fahrenheit).

field.name: Humidity(%)
field.description: Shows the humidity (in percentage).

field.name: Pressure(in)
field.description: Shows the air pressure (in inches).

field.name: Visibility(mi)
field.description: Shows visibility (in miles).

field.name: Wind_Direction
field.description: Shows wind direction.

field.name: Wind_Speed(mph)
field.description: Shows wind speed (in miles per hour).

field.name: Precipitation(in)
field.description: Shows precipitation amount in inches, if there is any.

field.name: Weather_Condition
field.description: Shows the weather condition (rain, snow, thunderstorm, fog, etc.)

field.name: Amenity
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of amenity in a nearby location.

field.name: Bump
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of speed bump or hump in a nearby location.

field.name: Crossing
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of crossing in a nearby location.

field.name: Give_Way
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of give_way in a nearby location.

field.name: Junction
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of junction in a nearby location.

field.name: No_Exit
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of no_exit in a nearby location.

field.name: Railway
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of railway in a nearby location.

field.name: Roundabout
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of roundabout in a nearby location.

field.name: Station
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of station in a nearby location.

field.name: Stop
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of stop in a nearby location.

field.name: Traffic_Calming
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of traffic_calming in a nearby location.

field.name: Traffic_Signal
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of traffic_signal in a nearby location.

field.name: Turning_Loop
field.description: A POI annotation which indicates presence of turning_loop in a nearby location.

field.name: Sunrise_Sunset
field.description: Shows the period of day (i.e. day or night) based on sunrise/sunset.

field.name: Civil_Twilight
field.description: Shows the period of day (i.e. day or night) based on civil twilight.

field.name: Nautical_Twilight
field.description: Shows the period of day (i.e. day or night) based on nautical twilight.

field.name: Astronomical_Twilight
field.description: Shows the period of day (i.e. day or night) based on astronomical twilight.

recordSet.name: US_Accidents_March23.csv
recordSet.description: Comprehensive countrywide accident dataset spanning from February 2016 to the end of March 2023.

keywords: subject > people and society > law > government > public safety
name: US Accidents (2016 - 2023)
description:
### Description
This is a countrywide car accident dataset that covers __49 states of the USA__. The accident data were collected from __February 2016 to March 2023__, using multiple APIs that provide streaming traffic incident (or event) data. These APIs broadcast traffic data captured by various entities, including the US and state departments of transportation, law enforcement agencies, traffic cameras, and traffic sensors within the road networks. The dataset currently contains approximately __7.7 million__ accident records. For more information about this dataset, please visit [here](https://smoosavi.org/datasets/us_accidents).


### Acknowledgements
If you use this dataset, please kindly cite the following papers:

- Moosavi, Sobhan, Mohammad Hossein Samavatian, Srinivasan Parthasarathy, and Rajiv Ramnath. “[A Countrywide Traffic Accident Dataset](https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.05409).”, 2019.

- Moosavi, Sobhan, Mohammad Hossein Samavatian, Srinivasan Parthasarathy, Radu Teodorescu, and Rajiv Ramnath. ["Accident Risk Prediction based on Heterogeneous Sparse Data: New Dataset and Insights."](https://arxiv.org/abs/1909.09638) In proceedings of the 27th ACM SIGSPATIAL International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems, ACM, 2019. 

### Content
This dataset was collected in real-time using multiple Traffic APIs. It contains accident data collected from February 2016 to March 2023 for the Contiguous United States. For more details about this dataset, please visit [here]. 

### Inspiration
The US-Accidents dataset can be used for numerous applications, such as real-time car accident prediction, studying car accident hotspot locations, casualty analysis, extracting cause and effect rules to predict car accidents, and studying the impact of precipitation or other environmental stimuli on accident occurrence. The most recent release of the dataset can also be useful for studying the impact of COVID-19 on traffic behavior and accidents.

### Sampled Data (New!)
For those requiring a smaller, more manageable dataset, [a sampled version is available which includes 500,000 accidents](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1U3u8QYzLjnEaSurtZfSAS_oh9AT2Mn8X). This sample is extracted from the original dataset for easier handling and analysis. 

### Other Details
Please note that the dataset may be missing data for certain days, which could be due to network connectivity issues during data collection. Regrettably, the dataset will no longer be updated, and this version should be considered the latest. 

### Usage Policy and Legal Disclaimer
This dataset is being distributed solely for research purposes under the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-ShareAlike license (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0). By downloading the dataset, you agree to use it only for non-commercial, research, or academic applications. If you use this dataset, it is necessary to cite the papers mentioned above.

### Inquiries or need help?
For any inquiries or assistance, please contact Sobhan Moosavi at sobhan.mehr84@gmail.com
